channel.title: Automation on ifconfig.it
channel.description: Recent content in Automation on ifconfig.it

item.title: Are we the last generation of Network Engineers?
item.description: Automation is today a word that can be both scaring and exciting at the same time. The scary part is often related to the question: will robots steal my job? Federico Pistono says that’s ok. We read articles about how many jobs will not exist anymore soon, and sometimes how new jobs will be create to support automation. The most advanced analysts try to predict how a society can survive with massive unemployment.

item.title: HP Procurve to Cisco switchport migration with Python and Netmiko
item.description: Summertime usually means a busy period for Network Engineers, customers are on holidays and we have the opportunity to performs all the changes that impact network connectivity. For me this usually means core switch replacement. Today I was moving a configuration from an HP8200 to a Cisco 4500, taking care of all the details of ports, trunks, vlans. From this: to this: When a task is manual, boring, repetitive and error-prone my automation skills came to help.
